title: Im excited to reach lvl 30 and join the cool kids in ranked
body:
I'm actually really excited this is my first season ever no smurfs nuffin and i'm really excited to do my placements and grind out i know ill probably place high bronze but i'm excited regardless to grind with my friends and learn a bunch about this wonderful game.



I have my flame suit on so go crazy idc :D

replies.body: I would recommend playing a lot more normals before hopping into ranked.

how much longer??


i mean i play with gold 1 players mostly and i can keep up with their friends in friendly games and at meet ups and junk.

Fuck these idiots that say wait, you'll never know how good you are at Ranked until you actually get in there and play it. I'm getting right into Ranked the second I hit 30 and I'll spend the rest of my time climbing from wherever I'm placed.

Take the plunge! And remember: **/mute all** you can just ping whatever needs to be said.

Yeah, ignore everyone with experience, what do they know anyway! /s

Even before they drastically cut the experience you need to get to 30, getting to 30 meant you had next to no clue what you were doing. People give this advice because time and time again Ranked is harder than people think it will be, then they complain about getting stuck in Elo Hell as they spend the entire season climbing out of the lowest ranks only to be placed back in there with the new season.
Elo hell exists _because_ of people who jump right in from level 30.
This is my biggest issue. The fact that someone hitting level 30 STARTS in silver is dumb. Getting new players in your ranked games is very frustrating....and it's just a toss up of who gets them.
If they play well enough to be in silver, how is it dumb that they are in silver?
Getting a high elo smurf in your first game isn't what I would call playing well enough to be in silver.
but one game doesnt put you in Silver.
The first games are heavily weighted (so that smurfs can climb easier). So if you win your first game, you're pretty much silver.

1. Elo hell is a myth. Or an excuse for people who prefer to blame everything around them instead of improving. And League is full of those.
2. People who jump into ranked right from level 30 get matched with players of similar skill level, i.e. also newcommers.

1. Sometimes there's no knowledge to be gleaned from a losing game, where every lane but yours is on a mission to feed the hungry. Sure you can try and improve, but the idea that you can't place any blame for losses on teammates is ridiculous. So if a win / loss isn't entirely in your hands, logic dictates that elo hell can exist.

2. Two people that were unranked, fresh level 30s were in my gold promos last season, and they both went 0-5 by around 8 minutes in. I'm not sure where you've gotten your information, but you are wrong.

3. Seems funny to me that you're posting this on an unranked account.

Nah it's kinda real. I got out but holy shit, people won't listen there.

(Gold was still hell though)
Hi

I would try to get atleast 200 normal game wins before going into ranked. It is a whole new ballpark than normals are, even up against Gold.

This way you get game experience and champion knowledge, as well as runes.

runes pages are the only thing that really stumps me sometimes 

this isn't my first moba but its the only one i've played with runes
rune pages are very, very important, i would try to have atleast 3 before going into ranked
Bull. Two sets of runes can easily carry you to high dia

You are right, they can easily be enough.

But think this way, one for AP, one for AD, and one for tanks. If you don't play any tanks at all, then no need, but in general it is nice to have one for each.

T2 Runes are enough for Ranked.
The actual difference between T2 and T3 runes is so small in terms of stats that it's barely noticeable but T2 Runes are hell of a lot cheaper for full specific pages, for champions/class. Don't worry yourself about T3 runes for the moment, that's something you'll gradually buy when you get to an IP surplus that you won't spend on new champions.

You realize that means totally nothing at all right? You could be playing with challenger players in norms and it would mean nothing at all. No one tries in norms, people are more likely to troll and lose on purpose then to actually try to win in norms.
Heh, someone probably never experienced high-MMR normals

Me personally? No cause i quit norms as soon as i got 30. Yes i was one of those people, regardless of it being a mistake however ive seen many high elo players in norms and they troll even more then silvers/bronzes do in norms.
Thank you you just saved my promos
Ah, youthful optimism, warms the heart... good luck in bronze V.

Play ranked whenever you want, except:

* With a champ you've never played.
* With some new off-meta thing you've never tried.
* When you don't really feel like putting in the effort to win.

Have fun man. :)

{{champion:51}}

> * With a champ you've never played.

New {{champion:19}}  day 1 in ranked? Let's go!

Well, i started to play league right when Vel'koz was released (2014 i think?) and i spent 1 whole year playing only normal games ( i had about 1.1k normal by the end of the year) but just because i didn't care about ranked at all back then.Then last year ( begining 2016) i started playing ranked for the first time and after i finished my placements i got placed in Silver 2 and in just 2 weeks i climbed to Gold 2. By the end of the year i managed to finish Plat 3. Morale of story: play alot od normals before starting rankeds, it will help u alot.

I hope your flame suit is enchanted (or atleast at max level).. 
Anyways, gl hf {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

pro tip, dont. wait until you complete like 4 rune pages and get a pool of 10 champs you can comfortably play, otherwise you will go straight to bronze 5~bronze 3 and you'll be miserable.

these things matter and you cant go in with ap runes with garen/yi in the top/jungle.
This is actually terrible advice
Why are you spamming this thread with bad advice?
Tell me ONE good reason why shouldn't he play ranked as soon aa he dings lv30

This for one...

https://i.gyazo.com/f1cda042f88aa52d5cf7c9e7b8ab89c8.png

On top of him not understanding the support role which he will more than likely have to play eventually. He has a pretty poor grasp on any champion that isn't miss fortune and his performance with her is just starting to become decent.

Why would you want someone like this to dive into ranked?

https://i.gyazo.com/aa5d8fb100fc23177666abcc155a5df1.png

Do you think he will all of a sudden start winning vs the bronze and silver players he is losing to in normals? I personally don't like to send someone into the fire telling them they won't get burned.

Ranked doesn't care if you play terribly like this one or godlike. Your rank (and MMR) will be adjusted so that you play against equally terrible (or godly) players. 
I bet you would have the same or even worse stats if you played against diamonds... The point is, with enough games you WILL have 50% winrate, and your rank will be accurate

If anything, playing ranked is good for him because he will eventually face same players as he is. I don't get why people think of ranked as "ULTIMATE CHALLENGE - WINNER GETS ALL“

I doubt anyone just mindlessly plays ranked to get stuck, people want to win and improve. If he doesn't even understand the roles in the game or have rune pages he can wait on trying to learn more difficult things due to his inexperience/stat disadvantages holding him back.

All you are encouraging is another person to get stuck in silver/bronze off of placements and then whine about their teammates since they don't understand fundamental mechanics in the game.
You can't get stuck in ranked Q_Q

Just one of many examples

http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=mrswoop

Over 250 ranked games already this season and still bronze. That is almost 8 games a day for next to no progress, that seems pretty stuck to me (not even getting started on the poor bastards in bronze 5).
So what? He's just bad and he doesn't want to improve. Do you really think normal games would help him to overcome this?

No, but that was not the point. You said that you can't get stuck, I showed you otherwise. Nothing about that sequence of events matters when OP still has no runes, no champion pool, and is missing fundamental knowledge about the game.

Do they start you off in basketball running formations and complex drills moving the ball, or do they have you run around a gym simply learning how to dribble? OP is just finishing learning how to dribble/other basic maneuvers, he needs to learn about what offensive and defensive strategies exist, when they work, and why we use them before he starts trying out for the competitive team.
How are normals different from ranked games? There aren't any metaphorical formations or complex drills in bronze ranked... it's exactly the same as normals, except your rank is visible.

I'd like it if you could focus so I don't have to repeat myself.

> I doubt anyone just mindlessly plays ranked to get stuck, people want to win and improve. If he doesn't even understand the roles in the game or have rune pages he can wait on trying to learn more difficult things due to his inexperience/stat disadvantages holding him back.
> 
> All you are encouraging is another person to get stuck in silver/bronze off of placements and then whine about their teammates since they don't understand fundamental mechanics in the game.

People want to win and climb in ranked, the sandbag that is OP would be very frustrating to have on a team if he doesn't understand how to even buy a support item. Depending on the opposition support that could be a 1k gold disadvantage at 20 minutes just for starting the wrong item.

Think of formations as rotations and drills as itemization choices.

If you're getting to level 30 any time in the last year and a half, you haven't played enough to be ready for Ranked. You're going to get flamed so hard you'll wish you were playing an MMO instead, and Riot didn't tell people that since they halved the exp needed for 30 you'll be far less ready than any other group of players has been in the past.

At the very least, since you're "excited to grind," grind for at least 2 full tier 3 rune pages. You don't want 15 AD and 20 AP being the reason you lose every match.

And so you know, rankings work in reverse. Bronze 5 isn't high, it's low.

You dont learn about this game playing ranked really. Same reason what you intend to do is why. Other level 30 kids rush into ranked not knowing anything... how do you expect to learn anything from people going in not knowing anything like what your doing?

Learning is done outside the game, experience is gained inside the game. Time spent watching videos, reading guides, studying the wiki are how you learn about the game and can be done anytime before level 30.

If youre going from 30 straight into ranked, I doubt you will place high bronze. Especially if you think thats how you learn about the game. My advice would be to learn a few champs in normal draft really well (15 or more games), then play as many as you can at least one or two matches before you go in.

You wont do this though.

You will be like all the other burdens I see in matches with little clue as to what to do, and no one will have the time to explain it to you. They will just expect you to know. It will be your fault for not knowing what to do though, so their flames will be correctly directed at you when you get them. Why should you know? Because it would only take a small percentage of your time to acquire knowledge outside of the game, then bring it into the game. Combine knowledge with experience to develop skill.

Good luck I guess.

**NOOOOO! DON'T DO IT!!!!**

https://media3.giphy.com/media/3ornka9rAaKRA2Rkac/giphy.gif
Don't play ranked until you actually have some decent game knowledge. Trust me.

i highly suggest u dont play ranked until u have **either** cumulative mastery point of 200k at bare minimum **OR** 100k mastery on a single champ. ~~or if an high elo player's carrying u~~
 About an year ago riot decided to cut the total EXP needed for lv30 by half, and new players werent getting enough experience by the time they hit lv30, let alone incomplete rune pages. ~~and most people who jump into ranked immediately end up as Bronze V and be stuck in the elohell~~

http://championmasterylookup.derpthemeus.com/
this site should tell u how much cumulative mastery u have.
Reasoning behind this? I can't find any real argument for your post.

200k cumulative mastery was around the amount people would have gained by hitting lv30 before the EXP reduction, and jumping directly into ranked upon reaching lv30 was fine back then.
100k+ mastery points on a single champ generally means knowing that champ inside-out well. Maybe depending on people, i guess it could be 50k or 1million
Mastery is shit metric to estimate how well you play said champion, let alone game as whole.
